definition: laughable/funny/ridiculous
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
laugh/smile/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Hahah comment from occidentals jelous people are so funny.
sentences.chinese: 哈哈哈那些西方人酸溜溜的評論真是好笑。

sentences.english: I laughed in my sleeve at his menaces .
sentences.chinese: 對於他的恐嚇，我暗自好笑。

sentences.english: He liked to tell funny stories to make people laugh.
sentences.chinese: 他喜歡講好笑的故事逗人發笑。

sentences.english: The guy in his undies thinks this is especially funny, and justifiably so.
sentences.chinese: 那個內男褲覺得這個特別好笑，而且笑得有憑有據。

sentences.english: Hehehe, come to think of it, this is quite funny.
But the stock market crash was nothing to laugh about.
sentences.chinese: 然而，股災是沒有什麼值得好笑的。

sentences.english: You look ridonkulous in those glasses!
sentences.chinese: 你帶着個眼鏡看起來太好笑了。

sentences.english: Hahah comment from occidentals jelous people are so funny.
sentences.chinese: 哈哈哈哪些西方人酸溜溜地評論真是好笑。

sentences.english: Tom:Come watch TV with us, this episode is really funny.
sentences.chinese: 快來一起看電視，這集真的好好笑。

sentences.english: It was great fun, but the outcome was nothing to laugh at.
sentences.chinese: 雖然剛開始很好笑，但結果卻令人起敬。

sentences.english: Public Security officials found this amusing and suggested Li was embezzling money.
sentences.chinese: 公安局的官員覺得這個很好笑，並建議李私吞了錢。

sentences.english: We are amused to see that he slid on a banana skin.
sentences.chinese: 看到他被香蕉皮滑倒我們感到很好笑。

sentences.english: Funny yet tragically true, how ignorance can be to this extent.
sentences.chinese: 竟然無知到這個地步，好笑卻又可悲地真實。

sentences.english: Parkin was so surprised and amused that he overbalanced and fell from the ladder.
sentences.chinese: 帕金又喫驚又好笑，失去平衡，從梯子上摔了下來。

sentences.english: How are you at finding the funny side of situation?
sentences.chinese: 你擅長找到境遇好笑的一面嗎？

definition: to be happy/to be in a good mood
to burst out laughing/to laugh
lit. not to know whether to laugh or cry (idiom)/both funny and extremely embarrassing/between laughter and tears
cannot help laughing/unable to restrain a smile
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
comical/funny/amusing/old pr. [gu3 ji1]/huaji, a form of comedy performance popular in Shanghai, Jiangsu and Zhejiang
funny/ridiculous
(literary) to smile
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
to be annoyed/to get angry
to remain silent/to have nothing to say/(coll.) speechless/dumbfounded
flabbergasted/astonished
lit. not to know whether to laugh or cry (idiom)/between laughter and tears
in deadly earnest/deadpan
to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
can't help/cannot but
